ThingDef.label: Nickel Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nickel belongs to the transition metals and is hard and ductile. Nickel is a silvery-white metal with a slight golden tinge that takes a high polish.

ThingDef.label: Cobalt Alloy
ThingDef.description: Cobalt-based blue pigments have been used since ancient times for jewelry and paints, and to impart a distinctive blue tint to glass. The color was later thought by alchemists to have been caused by the metal known as bismuth.

ThingDef.label: Pyrolusite Ore
ThingDef.description: Pyrolusite is a black mineral and the ore of maganese. Manganese phosphate is used as a treatment for rust and corrosion prevention on steel.

ThingDef.label: Manganese Alloy
ThingDef.description: Manganese is a product of the black mineral called pyrolusite. Manganese phosphate is used as a treatment for rust and corrosion prevention on steel.

ThingDef.label: Wolframite Ore
ThingDef.description: Wolframite was highly valued as the main source of the metal tungsten, a strong and quite dense material with a high melting temperature used for electric filaments and armor-piercing ammunition, as well as hard tungsten carbide machine tools.

ThingDef.label: Tungsten Alloy
ThingDef.description: Tungsten, also known as wolfram or wolframite, is a hard, rare metal. Tungsten's hardness and high density give it military applications in penetrative projectiles. Tungsten compounds are also often used as industrial catalysts.

ThingDef.label: Chromium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Chromium is a steely-gray, lustrous, hard and brittle metal. It doesn't have any use on its own, but it can be combined with nickel and maganese to make nichrome alloy at the electric ark furnace.

ThingDef.label: Silver Ore
ThingDef.description: This metal is mostly used as a commodity currency. It can also be used for making attractive decorations when smelted into sterling silver alloy.

ThingDef.label: Gold Ore
ThingDef.description: The most seductive metal of them all. Millions have died in attempting to feed the endless human thirst for gold. This soft metal is little use on its own, but is strikingly beautiful and very rare.

ThingDef.label: Iron Ore
ThingDef.description: Iron ores are rocks and minerals from which metallic iron can be economically extracted. It can be refined in different ways to make sulfur, chromium, cast-iron and steel.

ThingDef.label: Nickel Ore
ThingDef.description: Nickel ore is a kind of natural mineral formation where the nickel content is sufficient for a cost-effective extraction of the metal. Small amounts of cobalt can also be extracted during the alloy making process.

ThingDef.label: Copper Ore
ThingDef.description: Copper is a ductile metal with very high thermal and electrical conductivity. Pure copper is malleable and reddish-orange in color. It is used as a conductor of heat and electricity, a building material, and as a constituent of various metal alloys.

ThingDef.label: Bauxite Ore
ThingDef.description: Bauxite is the ore form of aluminium. Aluminum is a silvery white, soft, nonmagnetic, ductile metal that is remarkable for the metal's low density and for its ability to resist corrosion due to the phenomenon of passivation.

ThingDef.label: Ilmenite Ore
ThingDef.description: Ilmenite is the ore form of titanium. Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transitional metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine.

ThingDef.label: Copper Alloy
ThingDef.description: Copper is an alloy of copper ore. It is mainly used for its high conductivity in electrical applications.

ThingDef.label: Aluminium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Aluminium is an alloy of bauxite ore. A similar and less valuable metal than copper, it is mainly used for its high conductivity in electrical applications.

ThingDef.label: Cast-Iron Alloy
ThingDef.description: Cast-Iron alloy is a group of iron-carbon alloys with a carbon content greater than 2%. Cast-iron is a cheap, general purpose building material metal.

ThingDef.label: Steel Alloy
ThingDef.description: Steel alloy is a group of iron-carbon alloys with a carbon content less than 2%. A tougher metal than cast-iron that comes with a higher production cost.

ThingDef.label: Gold Alloy
ThingDef.description: Gold is a beautiful, precious alloy of gold and copper or bauxite.

ThingDef.label: Sterling Silver Alloy
ThingDef.description: Sterling silver is a valuable alloy of silver and copper or bauxite.

ThingDef.label: Sendust Alloy
ThingDef.description: Sendust alloy is produced by the reduction of silicon in presence of iron and aluminum. Sendust is useful as a de-oxiding agent with other metals. It is more durable than standard cast-iron or steel.

ThingDef.label: Spiegel Alloy
ThingDef.description: Spiegel alloy is an alloy of steel and manganese. Adding manganese to steel increases the hardness, corrosion resistance and resistance to tearing.

ThingDef.label: Melchior Alloy
ThingDef.description: Melchior is an alloy of copper, nickel and aluminum. This alloy combination has a higher resistance to corrosion and electricity than standard copper or aluminim alloy.

ThingDef.label: Stein Alloy
ThingDef.description: Stein is an alloy of iron, nickel and maganese. This combination produces a metal alloy that is tougher than sendust alloy.

ThingDef.label: Permalloy Alloy
ThingDef.description: Permalloy is a magnetic alloy of steel and nickel. It is useful as a magnetic core material in electrical and electronic equipment, or for magnetic shielding to block magnetic fields.

ThingDef.label: Alnico Alloy
ThingDef.description: Alnico is an alloy of steel, nickel, aluminum and cobalt. It has a high coercivity (resistance to loss of magnetism) and is useful to make permanent magnets or magnetic shielding.

ThingDef.label: Nichrome Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nichrome is an alloy of nickel, chromium and maganese. Nichrome alloy is typically used as a more resistant electrical wiring instead of copper or aluminum alloy.

ThingDef.label: Kovar Alloy
ThingDef.description: Kovar is an alloy of nickel, cobalt and iron. It is more resistant to wear and tear than basic metals. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even some prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Stellite Alloy
ThingDef.description: Stellite is an alloy of cobalt, chromium and tungsten designed for increased wear resistance.

ThingDef.label: Ferrotitanium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Ferrotitanium is an alloy of steel, titanium and carbon fiber alloy. It is very durable and somewhat beautiful.

ThingDef.label: Nitinol Alloy
ThingDef.description: Nitinol is an alloy of nickel and titanium. Nitinol is exceedingly difficult to make due to the exceptionally tight compositional control required, and the tremendous reactivity of titanium. It is exceptionally durable and somewhat beautiful.

ThingDef.label: Pobedite Alloy
ThingDef.description: Pobedite is an alloy of carbon fiber alloy, tungsten and cobalt. This composite alloy possesses a particularly high hardness, similar to that of a diamond.

ThingDef.label: Titanium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Titanium is a chemical element. It is a lustrous transition metal with a silver color, low density and high strength. It is highly resistant to corrosion in sea water, aqua regia and chlorine.

ThingDef.label: Wood Log
ThingDef.description: Wood from trees or other fibrous plants. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics. A raw stick of wood can be used as a weapon in a pinch. Can be processed into planks.

ThingDef.label: Wood Plank
ThingDef.description: Wood planks crafted from wood logs. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo
ThingDef.description: Bamboo is a type of wood-like grass. It is a fast growing wood alternative that is useful for construction.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo Plank
ThingDef.description: Bamboo planks crafted from bamboo logs. Useful for building structures, weapons and even simple prosthetics.

ThingDef.label: Cloth
ThingDef.description: Cloth woven from organic fibers.

ThingDef.label: Muffalo Wool
ThingDef.description: Muffalo wool is soft, light and provides very good insulation. Wool clothes can keep the body warm even in extreme conditions.

ThingDef.label: Camel Hair
ThingDef.description: Camel hair clothing is usually worn by desert travelers to protect them from the heat. It provides excellent insulation due to its thermostatic properties.

ThingDef.label: Alpaca Wool
ThingDef.description: The remarkably soft wool of an alpaca. It is useful for clothing.

ThingDef.label: Hemp
ThingDef.description: Hemp is a type of cloth woven from weed. It is the same weed that people like to light up and smoke. Watch out for fire sources!

ThingDef.label: Ram Wool
ThingDef.description: The remarkably soft wool of a ram.

ThingDef.label: Devilstrand Cloth
ThingDef.description: Fabric spun from microfibers extracted from silk-producing Devilstrand mushrooms. Very tough, but insulates no better than cloth.

ThingDef.label: Synthread
ThingDef.description: Spacer-tech synthetic fabric designed for making ordinary clothes. It is soft, light, strong, and insulates well.

ThingDef.label: Hyperweave
ThingDef.description: High-tech nano-fibers woven into sheets. It is somewhat heavy, but is incredibly difficult to break. The secrets of its production are known only to the most advanced glitterworld cultures.

ThingDef.label: Kevlar
ThingDef.description: Kevlar is a woven combination of plastic and synthetic fibers that is often used for combat-related protective armor.

ThingDef.label: Chitin
ThingDef.description: Chitin is a long-chain polymer. It can be obtained from the exoskeletons of insects or shelled creatures.

ThingDef.label: Raw Xerigium
ThingDef.description: A pack of herbal concoctions typically extracted from the xerigium plant. Less potent than industrial pharmaceuticals.

ThingDef.label: Medicine
ThingDef.description: Medicine is a combination of various medical supplies that medical personnel can use to heal the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Advanced Medicine
ThingDef.description: Advanced medical supplies from a high-tech glitterworld. A more potent version of standard medicine that can greatly aid in even the most serious of injuries.

ThingDef.label: Herbal Medicine
ThingDef.description: Herbal medicine is a basic collection of plant-based supplies that medical staff use to treat the wounded.

ThingDef.label: Glass Batch
ThingDef.description: Raw glass batch made from sand. It would be more useful when it is refined into glass frames.

ThingDef.label: Glass Frame
ThingDef.description: A transparent material that is quite popular despite being fragile. Glass is produced from glass batch, which is made from sand.

ThingDef.label: Reinforced Glass Frame
ThingDef.description: A stronger version of glass frames that is harder to work with, but has more potential uses.

ThingDef.label: Raw Cotton
ThingDef.description: Raw cotton from a cotton plant. It can be spun into cloth at a tailor's loom.

ThingDef.label: Raw Devilstrand
ThingDef.description: Raw devilstrand from a devilstrand mushroom. It can be spun into cloth at a tailor's loom.

ThingDef.label: Kindling
ThingDef.description: Wood kindling made from wood logs. Used as fuel in the steam generator.

ThingDef.label: Mulch
ThingDef.description: Mulch made from wood planks, nitre and ash in a composter. Used for enriching soil or creating hydroponic basins.

ThingDef.label: Sand
ThingDef.description: Sand crushed from rubble or gathered from the ground. A necessary ingredient in making glass and silicon.

ThingDef.label: Silicon
ThingDef.description: Silicon is the one of the most common elements in the universe by mass, but very rarely occurs as the pure free element in nature. It can be produced by smelting sand.

ThingDef.label: Ethanol Fuel
ThingDef.description: A can of ethanol fuel produced from wheat, corn or rice at a brewery. It can be used to fuel the steam generator.

ThingDef.label: Electronic Components
ThingDef.description: An electronic component is any basic discrete device or physical entity in an electronic system used to affect electrons or their associated fields. Basic electronic devices like stoves or coolers use electronic components to process electricity.

ThingDef.label: Integrated Circuits
ThingDef.description: An integrated circuit is a set of electronic circuits on one small plate of semiconductor material, normally silicon. This can be made much smaller than a discrete circuit made from independent electronic components. Useful for more advanced electrical devices such as solar generators or a comms console.

ThingDef.label: Microchip Integrated Circuits
ThingDef.description: Integrated circuits with a microprocessor. It is a computer processor that incorporates the functions of a computer's central processing unit (CPU) on a single integrated circuit, or at most a few integrated circuits. Useful for highly advanced electronic devices, such as geothermal power plants.

ThingDef.label: Bioelectronic Devices
ThingDef.description: Bionic micro-electronic chips. These devices are too delicate and intricate to make by human hand. They need to be created through assistance via the robotic assembler.

ThingDef.label: Biomatter
ThingDef.description: Biomatter extracted from a human corpse. It can be used to grow natural organs in an organ vat.

ThingDef.label: Artificial Bone
ThingDef.description: A carefully crafted synthetic bone piece. Useful for repairing damaged bones.

ThingDef.label: Nitre
ThingDef.description: Major uses of potassium nitrate (nitre) are in fertilizers, tree stump removal, rocket propellants and fireworks. It is one of the major components of gunpowder.

ThingDef.label: Coal Ore
ThingDef.description: A lump of coal ore. A useful reaction agent in metal bar smelting.

ThingDef.label: Charcoal
ThingDef.description: A lump of charcoal. A useful coal ore substitute made by burning wood logs.

ThingDef.label: Rubble
ThingDef.description: Rough rubble stones created by smashing stone blocks or gathered from gravel on the ground. A useful ingredient for concrete. Can be smashed further to produce sand.

ThingDef.label: Ash
ThingDef.description: Ash is obtained by burning corpses or other materials in a crematorium.

ThingDef.label: Depleted Uranium Alloy
ThingDef.description: Depleted uranium is created by refining uranium ore through a gas centrifuge. The dangerous radiation has been removed, resulting in a unique high density and strong metal ideal for armor plating or armor-piercing projectiles.

ThingDef.label: Carbon Fiber Alloy
ThingDef.description: Carbon fiber alloy is an extremely strong and light fiber-reinforced nanomaterial polymer, which contains carbon fibers. It is created at a chemical laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Concrete
ThingDef.description: Concrete is a composite material composed of sand and rubble. It is a fluid material that bonds into a solid material over time.

ThingDef.label: Peat
ThingDef.description: Peat, also known as turf is an accumulation of partially decayed vegetation or organic matter that is unique to natural areas, such as peatlands, mires and swamps.

ThingDef.label: Biodiesel
ThingDef.description: A can of biodiesel fuel produced from raw beans at a biorefinery. It can be used to fuel the biogenerator.

ThingDef.label: Snow Block
ThingDef.description: Tightly packed snow formed into building blocks. It can melt if the temperature is above freezing. Can be built into a snow wall for a fast, cheap barricade.

ThingDef.label: Soft Clay
ThingDef.description: A lump of raw, soft clay gathered from water sources on the ground. Can be baked into clay bricks or tableware at a smelting furnace.

ThingDef.label: Clay Bricks
ThingDef.description: A brick of hardened clay baked at a smelting furnace. Can be used for construction purposes.

ThingDef.label: Gunpowder
ThingDef.description: Gunpowder, also known as black powder, is the earliest known chemical explosive. It is a mixture of sulfur, coal, and nitre. The sulfur and coal act as fuels, and the nitre is an oxidizer.

ThingDef.label: Napalm
ThingDef.description: Napalm is flammable liquid used in warfare. It is a mixture of a gelling agent and petroleum or a similar fuel.

ThingDef.label: Crude Oil
ThingDef.description: Crude oil is extracted from an oil fissure through use of an oil extractor. Can be refined at an oil refinery to produce polymers, parrafins, sulfur, synthetic ammonia or fuel.

ThingDef.label: Polymers
ThingDef.description: Polymers are a product of refined crude oil. It is a useful raw material used in creation of plastic, rubber, synthetic fibers and carbon at a petrochemical plant.

ThingDef.label: Plastic
ThingDef.description: Plastic is a useful raw material for building construction or item production, such as plastic tableware or weapons.

ThingDef.label: Rubber
ThingDef.description: Rubber is useful for a variety of things such as duct pipes, pumps or as a building material supplement/additive.

ThingDef.label: Synthetic Fibers
ThingDef.description: Synthetic fibers are artifical strands created from polymers and sulfur. They can be woven into synthread cloth at a tailor's loom, or woven with carbon into carbon fiber alloy at a chemical laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Carbon
ThingDef.description: Carbon is a fiber-reinforced polymer that is an extremely strong and light. It can be reinforced further with synthetic fibers to create carbon fiber alloy at a chemical laboratory.

ThingDef.label: Synthetic Ammonia
ThingDef.description: Synthetic ammonia is a product of refined crude oil. It is useful for fertilizing soil or creating impaction charges.

ThingDef.label: Paraffins
ThingDef.description: Paraffins are product of refined crude oil. It is useful in crafting medicines.

ThingDef.label: Sulfur
ThingDef.description: Sulfur occurs naturally as the pure element - native sulfur and as sulfide and sulfate minerals. Elemental sulfur crystals are commonly sought after by mineral collectors for their distinct, brightly colored polyhedron shapes.

ThingDef.label: Fuel
ThingDef.description: A fuel created from refined crude oil. It is needed to power the fuel power plant.

ThingDef.label: Inorganic Matter
ThingDef.description: A container of inorganic matter. It can be used to create specific resources at the inorganic matter converter.

ThingDef.label: Drill Head
ThingDef.description: A drill head for the drilling rig. Drilling rigs are placed on deposits of crude oil to drill oil fissures, an opening in the ground that can produce crude oil through the use of an oil extractor.

ThingDef.label: Pile of Books
ThingDef.description: A random assortment of books. Most are old and discarded classics, but occasionally a good quality book can be found.

ThingDef.label: Painting Supplies
ThingDef.description: A large assortment of brushes and paints. Perfect for any artist.

ThingDef.label: Mineral Sonar Module
ThingDef.description: This is a mineral sonar module. When deployed on the field with some energy packs, it can scan the surrounding area for metallic objects or hidden deposits of ores.

ThingDef.label: Alpha Poly
ThingDef.description: The first iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is only assembled in high end matter assemblers and is good for building structures in the chronospheres of stars.

ThingDef.label: Beta Poly
ThingDef.description: The second iteration in artificially constructed, atomically assembled dense matter. This man-made, extremely rare material is too expensive to be mass produced, and has only been used as material for indestructable space suits, unstoppable kinetic slugs and containment for miniture black holes.

ThingDef.label: Antimatter
ThingDef.description: Antimatter in the form of anti-atoms is one of the most difficult materials to produce. Antimatter in the form of individual anti-particles however, is commonly produced by particle accelerators and in some types of radioactive decay.

ThingDef.label: Magnetic Material
ThingDef.description: An advanced, strong magnetic material. Creation of such material is beyond the fabrication skills of anyone but an electromagnetic physicist.

ThingDef.label: Biosynthetic Material
ThingDef.description: An advanced, high ductility material.

ThingDef.label: Hex-Cell
ThingDef.description: A compact energy storing device. It is generally used for powering advanced weaponry or shock absorbers in powered armor.

ThingDef.label: Compound Paste
ThingDef.description: A bottle of compound paste, used for various crafting processes. The label reads: "DO NOT DRINK! Avoid sticking your fingers on surfaces after use!".

ThingDef.label: thrumbo horn
ThingDef.description: A thrumbo's horn. It's razor-sharp, very hard and priceless in most markets. This is a true trophy.
